Namespace FinSysPlatform.Domain.Script.Chart

Classes

ChartBarsTypeVisibility

Chart element visibility on chart of different types

ChartHitTestInfo

Hit test information, HitTest(Point)

IChartScriptCalculationUnitContainerExtensions

Extension methods for IChartScriptCalculationUnitContainer

Interfaces

IChartBarsTypeVisibilityProvider

An extension of IChartElement to provide visibility of the element on chart of different types

IChartElementContainer

A container to store a set of IChartElementContainer. Actually, it resembles a standard collection/set, but just has a specific methods to add/remove elements

IChartFixedScaleProvider

Declares fixed min/max levels. Can be used in chart elements to define a constant chart scale

IChartHitTestable

A feature of IChartElement which allows chart element to show a tool tip

IChartLevelProvider

Provides a set of levels to draw on chart

IChartRenderable

A feature of IChartElement which allows chart element to draw directly on chart canvas

IChartRenderableFirst

With this interface, any chart element IChartElement can intercept the beginning of the draw phase

IChartScaleJustificationsProvider

An extension for any chart object, which determines the rules of its scaling

IChartScriptCalculationUnit

Extends IScriptCalculationUnit with chart interaction. In other words, it is visual unit IChartElement

IChartScriptCalculationUnitContainer

The container to associated a set of units with "parent" unit In fact, there is no any link between parent and attendant on logic level: both units live separately and even may have different inputs The association makes sense only for a chart: having this association, the chart can add attendant units along with parent unit and then remove them at once Pay attention that attendant units feature is accessible for chart-based calculation unit, which means there is no any relation on IScriptCalculationUnit level. So, attendant units are not synchronized with parent in anyway. Particularly, there are no automatic actions: 1. They do no get the input Input of the parent automatically 2. They do not calculate their values along with master 3. They dot not change their states along with master 4. If a superior unit is being disposed, its attendant units are not disposed with it 5. If attendant unit is being disposed, it does not detach from superior unit automatically

On the other hand, there is automation on the chart's end. A chart uses the next logic 1. When the unit is being added to the chart, all its attendant units are also will be added 2. When the unit is being removed from the chart, all its attendant units are also will be removed

IComplexChartElement

An extended IChartElement which additionally has child elements

ISelectableChartElement

An extended version of IChartElement that supports selection

Enums

PlacementMode

The place for the chart element on the chart

ValueAxisPosition

Possible positions of Y-axis (value-axis) for any visual unit
